sentences.en: A strain of mysticism runs through his poetry.
sentences.cn: 他的诗作中贯穿着神秘主义的情调.

sentences.en: As a younger man Harrison was intrigued by Indian mysticism.
sentences.cn: 哈里森年轻时被印度神秘主义迷住了。

sentences.en: He had no mysticism about turtles although he had gone in turtle boats for many years.
sentences.cn: 他对海龟并不抱着神秘的看法,尽管他曾多年乘小船去捕海龟.

sentences.en: He was obviously inclined towards religious mysticism.
sentences.cn: 他有明显的宗教神秘主义倾向.

sentences.en: His acute perception was often clouded by mysticism.
sentences.cn: 他敏锐的洞察力常受到模糊思想的影响.

sentences.en: His acute perception was often mysticism.
sentences.cn: 他“敏锐”的洞察力常受到模糊思想的影响.

sentences.en: In Tantra, science and mysticism go hand in hand, as do sensuality and asceticism.
sentences.cn: 在坦陀罗, 科学与神秘主义手牵手, 就像纵欲与禁欲一样.

sentences.en: It is neither absolutism nor mysticism, nor nihilism, but full of logics and dialectics.
sentences.cn: 也不是什么神秘主义或虚无主义, 它的论证形式充满了逻辑与辩证法的意味.

sentences.en: None of the humour, the music, or the mysticism of high mathematics ever entered his head.
sentences.cn: 所有的幽默, 音乐和高等数学中的玄想,在他的头脑里从来都不存在.

sentences.en: People turn to mysticism at the turn of a millennium.
sentences.cn: 千年来临时,人们开始求助于神秘论.

sentences.en: Rich with ancient mysticism and long - lost secrets.
sentences.cn: 有著无数的古代神秘事物以及失落已久的秘密.

sentences.en: She has no inclination towards mysticism.
sentences.cn: 她一点也不倾向于神秘主义.

sentences.en: The moon has been a guide and object of admiration and mysticism during thousands of years.
sentences.cn: 月亮从古至今一直以来就像我们的指引一般同时也是我们仰慕的星球.

sentences.en: Theosophy and Anthroposophy, the concept of Atlantis also entered Nazi Mysticism.
sentences.cn: 只管是见神论和人智学, 亚特兰蒂斯的观点也进入法西斯神秘主义.

sentences.en: Through Theosophy and Anthroposophy, the concept of Atlantis also entered Nazi Mysticism.
sentences.cn: 尽管是见神论和人智学, 亚特兰蒂斯的概念也进入纳粹神秘主义.

sentences.en: White always mates, he thought with a sort of cloudy mysticism.
sentences.cn: 白子总将死对方, 他带着一种模模糊糊的神秘感觉这么想.

words.tran_cn: 神秘的；不可思议的；难解的
神秘地；故弄玄虚地；难以理解地
神秘，秘密；奥秘；神秘的事物
神秘化；困惑不解；骗人的把戏
使神秘化；使迷惑，使困惑

trans.tran_cn: 神秘，神秘主义，玄想（的谬说）
trans.tran_en: a religious practice in which people try to get knowledge of truth and to become united with God through prayer and  meditation
